intro: Micromeria thymifolia, commonly known as lemon verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like citrus and rue. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, lemon-scented leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in dry, rocky habitats. Its aromatic properties make it valuable in both culinary and medicinal applications.
